location: SOMEWHAT SEEDY TWO-STORY HOTEL IN ATLANTA

text: It's still more night than day as we look down on the HOT ATLANTA. The lit sign for the HOTEL ATLANTA may be the on source of light as we hear a metallic rattle.

We follow the metallic rattle to a door. The rattling sto and we watch the knob slowly turn. Tight on a feminine arm with a tattoo that announces "hop We pull back to find that both arms are employed in the pulling of what looks like a large suitcase. NICOLE MAGGEN, a beautiful but tired woman, finishes pull the suitcase that we now surmise to be a folded-up massag table out of the motel room. With her bra in one hand and the rickety table resting against the wall of the exterio 2nd floor hallway of the motel, she assesses her situatio She digs in her purse, lights a cigarette and continues digging in her purse. She finds a beat-up candy tin. She opens it and quickly sorts through a collection of burnt foils, heroin foils, looking for residue. Nothing. She now finds and holds up the 100 bucks she just made. S flips open her cheap phone and makes a call...she thinks better of it and hangs up.
NICOLE forces the clumsy table into the hatchback of a 19 Toyota Tercel and slams it shut.

We hear the electronic ring of her cheap cell phone on "speaker phone" mode. The phone rests on the passenger se We pull up to find NICOLE slumped with her head resting o the steering wheel. She is exhausted and irritated...
(as the phone rings) Don't pick up...don't pick up... don't pick up... 2. A MAN answers with music in the background..."Yo.." NICOL quickly picks up the phone.

It's Nic, do you have any? Good morning to you too. You're what? Well, where are you guys shooting today? Where? Text me the address. You have some...Okay. She hangs up the phone and catching herself in the rearvi she tries to smile.

The sun would be rising if the sky wasn't swirling with g clouds. We see the American Suites Hotel and recognize it a decent commuters' hotel near the airport in Orlando. Th sound of a clock radio breaks the calm of our picture.

Through the clock radio we loudly hear two morning drive- radio personalities spewing nonsensical patter... An attractive YOUNG WOMAN wrestles free of the covers and gets out of bed. She crosses naked through the room as a cell phone starts ringing. Back to the bed as WHIP WHITAKER rises into frame and inhabits the room like a lazy ape at the zoo. WHIP wears 40 some years of life experience like a medal. Smoke hang in the air and empty beers, a pint of vodka and two empty carafes of cheap hotel wine clutter the table as WHIP snatches up his phone and answers...

For the love of Christ! Look...just hold...HOLD ON. He aggressively drains the last four inches of beer from clear bottle and cracks the last fresh one that bobs in t hotel ice bucket. The naked, YOUNG WOMAN bends over to pick up her clothes. We witness her ass as a tanned glass vase with a perfect crack down the middle. Whip smiles, taking it all in... 3.

(into the phone) I've been up since the crack 'a dawn. What check? Tuition? How much does it cost to go there? The YOUNG WOMAN has re-lit the last half of a joint and i puffing it to life as WHIP is beckoning with his large ha The YOUNG WOMAN, looking more like a stripper by the seco hands the joint to WHIP who takes a masterful drag. WHIP shakes his head in violent disapproval to what he hears o the phone. He exhales in anger as he shouts into the phon

NO! NO! NO! You decided he needed private school...lemme talk to Knuckles. He's not? Tell'em the phone works both ways. Oh he's my son because you need a tuition check...that's great Deana. I'm glad you tracked me down in Orlando at 7 in the fucking morning to shake me down for money. Does he even like the fucking school? No I've never seen it. Yeah I wonder why not too. I gotta 9 o'clock flight, sit tight 'till I get back to Atlanta. How am I a liar? What? No, I'll call you. WHIP hangs up and continues to make quick work of the las beer as he stares through his thoughts and out the window
Was that your wife?
That was my ex-wife. But you Trina, you could be my second or third wife if you'd just C'mere. The YOUNG WOMAN we now know as TRINA smiles seductively..

Whip, don't even joke about that. Our flight's at 9, let's hit it. TRINA is still naked but she holds a navy blue skirt and white blouse as she hands WHIP his pants. WHIP can't help but pat that perfect ass as TRINA tries to skip away. ON THE RADIO We hear the opening bars of a familiar rock anthem...JOE COCKER's "I'm Feeling Alright" 4.
Yeah, I'm feelin' a little light- headed. I shoulda ate somethin'. WHIP leans over the motel table, picks up a soda straw th been cut in half. He efficiently sniffs up a line of coke

WHIP wears his pilot Blues and carries his hat as he stri confidently down the hallway. JOE COCKER continues to wai perfectly narrating the hero's swagger that WHIP maintain while passing bad light fixtures and ornate wall paper.

WHIP leans against the landing gear of the JACKSON-RIDGEF 88 PASSENGER JET -- He takes a swig from a small bottle o mouthwash -- gargles, then spits the green foam on the tarmac. WHIP wipes fatigue from his face as he stashes th mouthwash in his pocket, then quickly completes his visua walk around. He looks at the sky again as he steps on to jet way ladder. His foot slips, sending his shoe SPLASHIN to a puddle.
Son of a bitch! Whip shakes the rain out of his shoe as he continues up t stairs.
WHIP enters the jetway from the exterior door at the entr of the plane. TRINA is greeting a MAN and his SON.
Morning Miss Marquez.
Morning Captain Whitaker. WHIP waits as TRINA politely parts the stream of folks to allow WHIP to enter the plane.
WHIP exchanges a look with a MATURE FLIGHT ATTENDANT, MARGARET THOMASON. She can't help but smile... 5.
Captain Whitaker, that sky gonna hold? You're not gonna make me spend another night in Orlando?
Don't worry, Margaret I'm gonna get you home for your prayer meeting at...what is it? Jesus Christ Superstar 27th Baptist King Church? TRINA and CAMELIA SATOU, the other flight attendant, laug
That's right, Christ the King First Baptist Church on Hazel and 9th Street. And I'm still saving you a seat next to me. Offer stands...come on down.
One of these nights, Margaret, I'm comin'. You hold my seat. The girls laugh at the familiar exchange.
WHIP enters the cockpit, removes his hat and nods to KEN EVANS, our clean-cut, young first officer.
G'morning. Walk around is complete. Whip pulls his emergency oxygen mask off the bulkhead and takes a huge hit.
Emergency oxygen, checks. (offering the mask to
You want a hit?
No thank you sir.
(tries to break the chill) My pleasure to share the chair with ya'. Didn't we fly together... EVANS lets him hang... 6.
No sir, not that I remember. Ken Evans, sir.
Call me Whip.
Yes sir. WHIP studies this little Bible Thumper for a second befor
(calls to the galley) Margaret.
Sweetie, will you get me a coffee, black, lots of sugar. And some aspirin. You want something?
(looks to Margaret) No ma'am. Thank you.
Sir, it's 8:50.
Then let's push. I got a great `on time' record.
Yes sir, you gottit. And how you feeling today, sir? WHIP focuses on EVANS, trying to read into that statement
Tired, sir. But, this is a quick turn for me. Ten turns in three days. Off tomorrow. MARGARET returns with the coffee, placing it down near WH chair on an airline cocktail napkin.
Here's your coffee and the final manifest. 102 souls on board.
Thank you, thank you, thank you, you're a life saver. And Margaret gettem' tucked in, we're ready to push. 7. WHIP goes to the head. MARGARET and EVANS exchange a look
NICOLE gets out of her Tercel and slams the door twice be it closes. She checks the address on her phone and looks at the enormous mansion.

NICOLE pushes through the overly tall front door of the house. At first glance, it's completely empty, unfurnishe A GUY in cargo pants and a baseball hat sleeps sitting up against the huge dual staircase that leads to the second floor. Random boxes of video equipment are now evident as are thick cables that lead to a staircase going down. On the staircase she immediately encounters another YOUNG CREW GUY holding a tiny lap dog while standing next to a NAKED GIRL wearing a Shakespearean Military Helmet. The YOUNG CREW GUY holds up the "be quiet" finger to his lips NICOLE quietly makes her way down a few steps, stopping a the odd duo. We now hear activity downstairs, music. SUDDENLY the YOUNG CREW GUY frantically points at the NAK GIRL.
Othello you bastard! And she grabs the TINY DOG and hustles downstairs. NICOLE waits with the YOUNG CREW GUY until we hear....
NICOLE is free to walk all the way downstairs now.

NICOLE enters to reveal a large porn set with a Shakespea theme, specifically "Othello." We see an Elizabethan Four poster bed with a canopy surrounded by stone arches and cardboard Venetian Columns. In the bed we find an AFRICAN AMERICAN PORN ACTOR laying with TWO FEMALE ADULT ACTORS. A GIRL WITH DYED-BLONDE HAIR stands naked next to the thr smoking a joint as she shaves her crotch with a man's electric razor. 8. NICOLE approaches a YOUNG TATTOOED MAN who only wears boa shorts. He's talking with an OLDER ASIAN MAN as they groo pile of coke for snorting.
He sniffs a quick line and gets up to kiss her, she turns cheek avoiding the coke-frozen kiss.
Nicole, this is Tiki Pot. He's my partner in this new series, he knows a lot about porn.
Kip I need 2 grams of "h."

Tiki and I are trying to put the narrative back in porn. Our Desdemona hasn't shown yet. (a great idea hatches...) You should play Desdemona. FUCK YEAH! You got that fair skin. KIP is flirting, seeing if she'll consider it...
Desdemona? What the fuck? TIKI does a line and comes up babbling.
She do anal, two thousand, one hour.
I don't do porn, Kip. Just lemme see the "h."
Just listen, we're doing an Othello theme where the Moor finds you in bed with your nurse and-
He fucks me in the ass? 9.

Well...yeah. We're giving a whole new meaning to the "beast with two backs." That's actually a title we're toying with...'beast with two backs' or Hole-thelo or Butt Hole- thelo...would you be up for it?
College kid, very clean...BRETT?! A tall thin kid joins them. He wears a Moorish Headdress has a bath towel wrapped around his waist.
Show her the pipe- BRETT drops the towel...
Fuck you Tiki, you put that in your ass and call me in the morning. Kip, have I ever done that shit for you? Never. Asshole. NICOLE walks away. KIP follows her...at the door.

Nic...sorry, we're tweaked, okay baby girl. Hey, c'mon you wanna stay and shoot some stills for me, you're pics are awesome. And what's going on with you? You were clean for a while and... (she begins to cry) Sweetheart, don't cry.
I just need a little to smoke. (flashes the cash) I've got 100. KIP pulls a small tin foil square from his vest pocket.
No, keep your money, okay? But, Nicole, this is the Taliban baby, very big time. It will take you down.
I can handle it. 10.
Don't shoot this shit, it is way too heavy.
I'm just gonna smoke it. I haven't done needles in weeks.
Okay, no needles and take a little coke and if you start going down just whiff a little. Okay? I wanna see you... KIP hands her a tiny baggy of coke. He kisses her cheek.

Out the window...nothing...the rain pounds. WHIP leans cl to the windshield in an attempt to improve his view. EVANS reaches down and throws a switch. The windshield wipers go on. We can now see very clearly the path of lig the plane is to follow. WHIP looks to EVANS, smiles with stoned eyes.
Thanks junior. EVANS looks out at the rain...
Looks pretty ugly, sir.
A little rain never hurt anybody. We're not made of sugar. What's the RVR?
Half a mile. Right at minimums. Wind's gusting to 29. 30 is our crosswind max.
I know what our crosswind max is. Tellem were good to go at the end. EVANS just stares at WHIP. 11.
SouthJet 227, say intentions. WHIP looks right at EVANS. EVANS keys the radio.
Orlando ground. SouthJet 227 will be ready to go at the end. WHIP stares forward, not looking at EVANS.

Nervous passengers stare out the windows as the JR-88 lum along the tarmac, headed for the runway. We follow TRINA whose ass looks as good in a tight navy s as it does split bare with orange fluorescence. MARGARET speaks into the PA mic.

Ladies and gentlemen, the captain has turned on the seat-belt sign. Please be sure your seat-belts are securely fastened, and all carry-on items are safely stored in the over- head bin, or under the seat in front of you. Also, all personal electronic devices must be switched off, at this time. Today's flight time to Atlanta should be 52 minutes. Flight attendants please take your seats. 16 TRINA straps into her jump-seat. 16
Heavy rain lashes the nose of the plane. Lightning FLASHE We watch the plane steer on to the GLOWING center-line.
Whip inhales his coffee and readies himself for take-off. EVANS tries to relax, continuing with the checklist.
(reading the check-list) Elevator trim - set. Flaps, One, two, three - set. Radios - set. 12. One, two, three altimeters - set. Lights, pitot heat, de-ice - on. Transponders, set.
SouthJet 227, wind is one-zero-zero at seventeen. Runway 18L, cleared for take off. WHIP has razor focus as he places his hand on the throttl EVANS sits upright and prepares for battle.
(keys the mic) Cleared for take off, SouthJet 227. Whip pushes the throttles and the engines SCREAM as they spool up to full thrust. After a beat, he releases the brakes.

The passengers are pressed into their seats like blades o grass as the breeze of the plane's momentum moves them towards flight. The main lights in the cabin go out and t small glow of the aisle lights lead us back to the cockpi
WHIP mans the stick as he squints his eyes and tries to k the nose between the lights of the runway.
It's like a video game, right? WHIP laughs and turns to his copilot. EVANS is visibly nervous as he begins the take-off check...
Airspeed's alive, both sides... Engine instruments are in the green...100 knots crosscheck... The JR-88 fishtails as the main gear begins to hydroplane
Yep, nothing like a little 30 knot cross wind to exercise that sphincter muscle. Evans is jostled violently. 13.
That's wind shear! A micro burst! Whip's eyes are focused on the end of the runway. The RED THRESHOLD LIGHTS are approaching fast. The plane not lifting off.
Less than a thousand feet to go! Whip snaps at him.
Just watch my airspeed! C.U. The airspeed indicator reads 145...
V1...and... Now the air speed indicator climbs to 160...
...rotate. Whip pulls back on the yoke, and... The plane jerks up and we can hear the fuselage flex as w leave the ground. The plane is immediately buffeted by se turbulence.
That's wind shear for sure!
Yeehaw! Ride `em cowboy.
The passengers are rattled like a bag of marbles.

The plane is loping up as the rain continues to pound the windshield. The ascent is very bumpy as the turbulent win tosses the plane side to side. Copilot EVANS is communicating with Air Traffic Control... 14.
Orlando Departure...SouthJet 227, climbing out of 2500 for 5 thousand, runway heading.
Roger SouthJet 227. Turn left heading one-seven-zero. Climb, maintain niner thousand.
Left to 170. Climb, maintain niner thousand. EVANS quickly dials the heading and altitude into the aut pilot.
I don't want the auto-pilot. I'm flying.
What's your ride like, SouthJet
Before EVANS can answer, WHIP jumps on the radio.
Ah, Departure, we've got some rough chop here. I'd say moderate to... WHUMP!! The plane hits a severe bump! EVAN's headset turn sideways and he quickly rights it. WHIP chokes back a nervous chuckle.
(into his mic) No, severe. Definitely severe turbulence. No meal service today.
Roger that. Whump!! Once again the plane is violently rocked.

The passengers audibly HOWL as the roller coaster dip lif most of their stomachs into their throats. A few overhead luggage bins fly open and bags and coats rain down. 15. The THREE ATTENDANTS calmly collect the luggage and stow in the kitchen. They talk loudly for the benefit of the passengers.
(to a passenger) This happened last week, always bumpy outta Orlando. Right Cam? MARGARET grabs the cabin mic and addresses the passengers
Ladies and Gentlemen, the captain has asked that until we clear this air you stay seated with your seat belts fastened. Thank you.
The plane rocks and shutters. WHIP seems oblivious as he continues to serenade Evans.
Feelin' alright - Not feelin' too good myself - Feelin' alright - Not feelin' too good myself... WHIP is interrupted by Air Traffic Control.
SouthJet 227...Be advised there is a large convective cell four miles at your 11 o'clock. And another cell, 2 o'clock, 10 miles. Both moving rapidly.
Copy, Center.
Did you get that?
Gottit Skippy. I'm just tryin' to get birdie here outta this wind bowl...What did they clear us to?
We're cleared to Flight Level one- eight-thousand. 16.

head_text.subj: THE PLANE TAKES ANOTHER VIOLENT DIP

text: EVANS' headset flies off. His tie and all the loose equipment and coffee cups are thrown to the ground.
Goddamnit! Enough of this shit! WHIP pushes the yoke forward. The plane pitches downward.
What are you doing!?
Leveling off.
What!? WHIP points to the MFD screen.
See that sliver of blue sitting between those two ugly bastards? C.U. MFD screen: A narrow line of blue is visible between two monstrous convective cells.
That's a little pocket of smooth air squatting right over Lake Kissimmee... EVANS nervously squints at the screen.
And we're gonna thread that fucking needle. Turn me thirty degrees right! EVANS jumps on the radio.
(into his mic) Center. This is SouthJet 227, We need to divert 30 degrees right...
For weather.
(into his mic) ...for weather. 17.
SouthJet 227, this is Jacksonville Center. 30 Degrees, right, approved. Report back on course.

Report back on course. WHIP banks the plane to the right. Suddenly -- the plane falls 200 feet in 2 seconds. A huge air pocket pulls the rug out from under the JR-88. From the cockpit we can hear the passengers scream. EVANS holds on to his headset.
Oh, Lord!
He can't help you now, brother. WHIP remains cool as he rides more bad air. The plane now bounces rapidly over a non-stop succession of speed bumps
The passengers clutch each other as they rattle like bobb head dolls; it's getting worse.
WHIP pushes the throttle and the 17-year-old Jackson- Ridgefield JR-88 accelerates directly into a huge black cloud. He begins to dip the nose level to the ground.
Why are you leveling off, sir?

I'd like to spend less time in this shitty air, Kenny. Is that alright with you? WHIP pushes the 17-year-old Jackson-Ridgefield JR-88 dire into a huge black cloud. He begins to dip the nose toward the ground.
We're approaching maximum airspeed! 18.
Fucking right! I'm gonna need some speed to punch through this crap.
The passengers howl in fear as the plane pitches forward.
EVANS calls out to WHIP...
You're over-speeding!
Not yet!! The AIRSPEED INDICATOR moves from GREEN right up to the YELLOW line. WHIP banks the plane steeply to the right. From the cabin HEAR the passengers SCREAM! Now ATC comes on the radio...
Uh, SouthJet 227, this is Jacksonville Center. Say altitude.
Tell `em we're climbing.
(scared and lying badly) Center...uh...SouthJet 227 is leaving niner thousand...for Flight Level 180.
SouthJet 227, this is Center. You need to check your Mode-C. Your transponder indicates you're descending. EVANS looks at WHIP -- panicked.
You're useless Evans, shit! (keys the radio) 19. Center. This is SouthJet 227, we've encountered some bad air here. Some pretty severe downdrafts. We're in our climb now.
Roger. The shaking gets incredibly violent. WE HEAR SCREAMS from the cabin. Evans points to Whip's airspeed indicator.
Look at your airspeed! You're too fast for this rough air!
I'm right on the line Kenny. Right on the line. WHIP starts to hum the Joe Cocker song again as he cranes head up close to the windscreen -- looking intently at th dark sky.

C'mon sweetheart, show me the sun. Suddenly, we see a beam of light breaking through the bla clouds -- 12 o'clock high. A God ray. WHIP (cont'd) (CONT'D) Finally, daylight. WHIP banks the plane hard, lifting the nose -- pointing i directly at the crack in the darkness. He shoves the throttles to full power. The plane is banking, rising and accelerating.
The screaming passengers go quiet with the strange new development. The shaking has eased from a 10 to a 5.

Whip keeps the plane climbing steeply. The Vertical Speed Indicator shows we're ascending 2,000 feet per minute. Th altimeter spins up past 12,000 ft. 20. The murky grey outside becomes lighter and brighter, unti suddenly, in a dramatic reveal...

Instantly the air becomes perfectly smooth. Whip levels off and maneuvers between the two towering cl walls -- smooth as silk. Gliding over the fluffy white clouds and through the shimmering rays of the sun -- it feels like WHIP just fle the JR-88 into heaven. A joyous CHEER ERUPTS from the passenger cabin WHIP pulls the power back and switches on the auto-pilot. EVANS is cheery, almost giddy...
Glad that's over. WHIP, however, is very shaky and beaded with sweat.
How tall are we?
16 thousand. That was incredible sir...
Ken, turn us north and take us home. Your plane. EVANS looks at him and nods.
My plane.
(picks up the phone) Margaret, I'm coming out. WHIP hangs up, puts on his pilot hat and exits the cockpi

location: NICOLE'S GEORGIAN GARDENS APTS FRONT DOOR-ATLANTA-DA

text: NICOLE has her keys out as she hustles for her door. She looks to find the door slightly open. She pushes it fully open to see FRAN, the building manager, standing in her living room holding her camera. He tries to be casual... 21.
Where you been Nicole? She is scared and pissed by his invasion of her space.
Fuck! Fran...get out.
You're like a little ghost. I never know when you're here.
Get the fuck out Fran! She grabs the full-bodied 35 MM camera from him.

As the building manager I have a legal right to enter an apartment if I believe the occupant is unwell. Especially if said occupant is not current on her rent. He takes a slimy step towards her. She steps away.
Fran, please just gimme a minute. Get out. I have the rent. I will bring it down to you. Just let me shower.

You could just bring the check down now, use my shower. I got good water pressure. You know that... FRAN leans against the door frame, trying to strike a seductive pose. NICOLE smiles and holds up her camera.
You're in the perfect light Fran. (he smiles, preening) Back up a little...little more. FRAN steps outside and on to the landing.
NICOLE kicks the door shut and locks it, escaping FRAN wh calls through the door. 22.
Tricky tricky, girl. Alright, so you shower up and come down. For real. We don't gotta talk about the check. Hang out a lil bit... NICOLE puts her camera down gently on the table.

In your fucking dreams. She now flings her purse on the ground in frustration...t contents spill on to the carpet. Amidst the flotsam we fo on yet another candy tin that springs open. NICOLE fixes stare at the hypodermic needle resting inside.

WHIP exits the lavatory drying his hands with a towel. He looks down the aisle to see TRINA far down the cabin. TRI sees WHIP, comes back up the aisle and stands with her ba to him watching the passengers. WHIP opens a bottle of orange juice and takes a big swig. then pours half of it in the sink. WHIP places the open juice bottle on the liquor cart, reaches up, and grabs th cabin mic to address the passengers.

Folks, this is Captain Whitaker. If you look up, I'm here in the galley. I will wave to you. WHIP steps into the aisle so the passengers can see him. WHIP waves with a calm smile that would put anyone at eas

Good Morning. I apologize for the bumps, but Florida just doesn't seem to like us Georgians. Must be the beatin' the Bulldogs put on the Gators last fall. Titters of laughter from the passengers as WHIP moves the half step he needs to put himself behind the liquor cart.

Stretch out and relax. The air might stay a little cranky so I'm gonna ask that you sit tight if you can, with your seat belts fastened. 23. We now watch from behind WHIP as his free hand reaches in the top drawer of the liquor cart and pulls three small v bottles out.

We won't have beverage service but the girls will walk through with water and snacks and I'll have you in Atlanta in about 40 minutes. Thank you. WHIP puts the mic to its hook. Alone in the galley and ou of view, he quickly empties the vodkas into the orange ju bottle and replaces the cap. Whip shakes the juice as he tosses the little empties into the galley trash. Whip tak a healthy pull from the spiked juice, downing nearly half WHIP knocks on the cockpit door. MARGARET emerges and WHI disappears in to the cockpit.

Framed photos on a bureau show: Christmas around the tree with Mom (30) and Dad (33) and a girl who's 8 and a boy w 5. (In the reflection of this photo we see a flame cookin heroin in a spoon.) Another photo depicts an 8 year-old girl's birthday party (In the reflection of this photo see wee Nicole tying off A last photo shows NICOLE (30)and her mom (54). They are both wearing kerchiefs. We can see that her mom is gaunt has no hair under her kerchief. (In the reflection of thi photo we see the needle injected into her arm.) A HYPODERMIC NEEDLE is placed in front of that picture. N to the photos is a small CD station that NICOLE taps to l and turns up. The opening bars of Michael Fitzpatrick's "Medication" begin to play. We pull wide to see NICOLE pull the bra from her arm that used to tie off with. Her face is pure happiness. Clothes and a peach crate filled with camera equipment jo suitcase on its side that acts as a coffee table. NICOLE picks up her camera and admires it before putting it down She picks up the cigarette she had staged pre dope fix an reaches for the lighter. She laughs and hums, pulls out g a brush...She's holding the brush when the first heavy wa of narcotic death washes over her. She leans back and use the wall for support. "Medication" is hitting its chorus. 24.

Oh man... She puts her arms out at her sides, euphoria. A slow, slo smile breaks across her face. She exhales slowly. She reaches for the now burning cigarette when the second wav heavy drugs hits. NICOLE looks up with fear. NICOLE (cont'd) (CONT'D) Oh no, oh no, oh no... She reaches for the little bag of coke that KIP gave her. Next she grabs her phone, flipping it open. As she tries dial it, she crumbles to her knees. NICOLE somewhat contr her fall to the ground, but her eyes are fading. The litt bag of coke falls from her fingers. There's no way to stem the tide of the oncoming overdose. NICOLE's arms stretch out in a frozen reach as her body s to the floor. On her back like a girl making angels in th snow as her eyelids flutter, she slips away. We hear a pounding on the door. FRAN is on the other side
Open up, Nicole! I can smell that shit cooking! Open Up! Nicole. Nicole!

WHIP is now passed out in the seat next to EVANS. He has approach plates (charts) folded and tucked between his sunglasses and eyes, creating a makeshift sleeping mask. lower jaw hangs open as his head bobs in deep sleep. Margaret leans in through the cockpit door talking to Eva
How long has Sleeping Beauty been out? EVANS maintains a military posture as he monitors the pla progress. The flight is smooth and the sky appears clear.
(looks at his watch) 26 minutes. We're going to start descending any second now.
Well, I guess you'll need to wake... 25. The radio interrupts...
SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. Descend and maintain Flight Level 30 thousand.
Descend and maintain 30 thousand. Evans dials 30,000 into the auto-pilot, but just as he ro the thumb switch to the "Descend" position...
Instantly the autopilot's Shut-Off SOUNDS. WHIP jolts awake and pushes up his sleeping "shades."
The fuck was that? Evans grabs his yoke and pulls.
The stabilizer feels really stiff.
Don't force it. EVANS does, we HEAR a big mechanical SNAP.
(referring to the noise) That came from the back!
I have very little trim control sir.
Margaret, get everybody strapped in tight. Margaret runs to the PA, leaving the cockpit door open.
It's pulling right. Hard!
Shit! It's locked up, ease up on the trim don't... 26.
I have no trim at all! The instrument panel LIGHTS UP like a Christmas tree -- A WARNING HORN BLARES.
We lost our hydraulics! WHIP pulls on his headset and keys his mic.
Center, this is SouthJet 227, we've lost our hydraulics...and, ah shit!
Power. Pull back the power! Evans pulls the throttles to idle.
(into his mic) ...we lost hydraulics and looks like...also our horizontal stabilizer.
SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. Understand you've lost hydraulics and stabilizer?
Turn on the back-up pumps! Evans engages the emergency hydraulic pumps.
Center, that's affirm. We are in a descent, an uncontrolled...
The plane starts to bank to the right, WHIP puts his hand against the wing-window to stay in his seat. EVANS grabs harness with both hands. The passengers shriek with terro
SouthJet 227, do you wish to declare an emergency!? 27. MARGARET stumbles into the cockpit.
Everyone's belted in. Are we going down? The plane suddenly pitches up, begins to roll, and dives again.
Get belted in, everyone belt in. Brace position! MARGARET rushes to the bench in the galley. Whip grabs his yoke and pulls. The plane inches up.
I've got some control on my side! My plane!
Your plane. Whips keeps back pressure on his yoke.
It's stiff as hell. We're pitching up. Slowing a bit.
SouthJet 227, say your condition. Whip continues to give orders to Evans.
We need drag. Throw out everything we've got. Speed brakes. Gear... (keys his mic) Uh, Center we're in a dive...lost vertical control.
SouthJet 227, Roger. Evans deploys the landing gear and applies the speed brak The wind ROARS as the gear doors drop. The airframe shake and rumbles violently.
...there enough hydraulics to drop the gear? 28.
Gear's down. I don't think hydraulics is the problem.
Throw out the flaps.
Too fast for flaps.
We need to start dumping fuel. Evans hesitates.

Do it! Evans quickly throws the "EMRG FUEL DUMP" switch. The airplane bucks and drops violently -- A chorus of terrified SCREAMS ERUPTS from the main cabin. Whip pulls on his yoke with all of his strength and the d shallows out a bit.
SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. How do you hear?
(keys his mic) Atlanta. This is SouthJet 227. We are in an uncontrolled dive, descending out of...shit I don't know...
(calls to Whip) 21 thousand!

(into his mic) ...21 thousand. We are declaring an emergency! We are dumping fuel! We have a jammed stabilizer...or something. We need a block of altitude to work the problem...and a heading to the nearest airport! (YELLS to Evans) I'm starting to lose it! The yoke pressure pulls Whip hard against his harness. 29.

SouthJet 227. Hartsfield-Jackson International is 10 O'clock and 20 miles from your present position. Maintain block altitude, Flight Level 10 thousand through Flight Level 20 thousand. Turn left heading 260.
260...we'll do our best.
It's getting away from me! I can't hold...dump the flaps!
We're still fast. The yoke is ripping away from Whip's hands.
DO IT! 30 percent! Evans dumps in the flaps. The JR-88 slows dramatically an balloons up.
That bought us a little time. We need to revert to manual control. Your side first, pul... Whip is interrupted by the radio.
SouthJet 227, Atlanta. Fuel dump is approved.
Thank you. Evans is confused and panicked, he throws his hands up.
Evans, look at me! Manual Reversion. Red lever, on the floor, far side of the console. Evans sees it.
I got it. 30.
Pull it up, turn it clockwise, push it back down. Evans does exactly that, then pulls back on his yoke -- nothing!
Nothing! No control!
Goddamn it!! Once again, the plane pitches into a dive. Whip strains t hold on.
I can't let go! Can you reach mine? Evans strains to reach Whip's Reversion Pull-Handle -- bu can't.
I can't reach it. Evans moves to release his harness, but Whip stops him.
No! Don't! Stay strapped in! (calls over his shoulder) Margaret! Margaret! Margaret tumbles into the cockpit, catching herself on Wh chair. She's crying.
Oh God, Whip. What's happening?!
Get strapped into the jump-seat. I need your help. Margaret opens the jump-seat and starts to pull on her harness. Throughout the scene she is struggling with her harness.
Margaret, see that red lever on the floor next to my chair? The one that says, Manual Control?
Yes. 31.
On the count of three you pull it up, turn it clockwise, then push it back down. OK? You ready? With tears streaming down her cheeks, she gives Whip a br nod.
Here we go. One, two... Whip releases back pressure from his yoke, pushing it for -- the plane noses downward 20 degrees!
...three! MORE TERRIFIED SHRIEKS come from the back. Margaret quick disengages then re-engages the large red handle. Whip pulls back on his yoke. The plane pitches up.
Ok. OK. We got something. It's still stiff as hell. Evans, put in some power! Evans pushes up the throttles. Whip gingerly applies pres to his stick. His face fills with worry.
I don't know. It feels like the son of a bitch wants to nose over. Then suddenly... WHAP! Whip's yoke flies out of his hands SLAMS forward! The plane banks right and drops! Margaret SCREAMS!
(he pulls back the power)
Now, ATC comes on the radio...
SouthJet 227, Hartsfield-Jackson is eleven o'clock and niner miles. I see you below 10,000. How are you doing? 32.
(keys his mic) Not good. You got anything closer? We're in a rapid dive here...
Roger, SouthJet 227. Uh...Clayton County is 2 miles at your 4 o'clock.
Negative. We're too high...we can't pitch for glide. We have no stabilizer control.

Copy, SouthJet 227. The plane continues to drop, increasing its nose-down attitude and speed. WHIP pushes both of his feet forward, stretching his body get leverage as we can see him pulling on the yoke, tryin get the plane out of the dive it's in. Evans is starting to lose it.
Oh Lord, we're descending at 4,700 feet per minute, out of 7,000. I
OK! Here's what we're going to do!
When I say, you retract the gear, retract the flaps and trim both ailerons. But every things gonna be opposite, so be sure to trim down. Margaret...
Trim down?! What are you gonna do?! Whip takes Margaret's hand and puts it on the throttle levers.
When I ask for power, push both of these forward. Got it?
What's your son's name? 33.
Trevor.
Say "I love you Trevor."
You mean trim up?! Right? You want me to trim up?
Why?
The black box.
I love you Trevor. Be a good boy. Mommy loves you.
What are we doing?! Why would I trim down?!
We're gonna roll it. Ready? Here we go. I've got control.
Just a little barrel roll. Don't panic. Relax. Let it roll. WHIP's body is fully extended as he pulls back on the yok and turns into a steep bank.
The G-force of the roll presses Evans away from the conso
Margaret! Can you reach it? Margaret bends forward and pulls the lever.
3,000...I think.
Let it roll. I got it! Whip quickly retracts the speed brakes, then PUSHES HIS Y FULL FORWARD! The clumsy liner does a slow, ungraceful ro
WE WATCH as the PASSENGERS scream as the plane rolls over they are suspended upside down.
The JR-88 finishes its barrel-roll, skimming over suburba rooftops and trees. A CLOUD-TRAIL of Jet-A SPEWING from i wings. As the INVERTED PLANE ROARS overhead the CAMERA PANS to f
Being rushed out of her apartment on a stretcher. The TWO PARAMEDICS and Fran (the landlord) instinctively duck as jet SCREAMS over.
(at the sight of the jet) Jesus Christ! What the Fuck!?

head_text.subj: NOSE RISES TO MEET THE HORIZON.

text: EVANS hangs in his harness straps as dust and smoke swirl around him. The inverted wings make an EERIE WHISTLING SO as the plane SHUDDERS violently side-to-side. 35.
Oh Lord Jesus! We're inverted! WHIP reaches over and pulls the throttles back. He sudden seems strangely calm, comfortable with his fate...
We're level. We can maintain altitude like this.

TRINA struggles to stay in her seat as she looks at the passengers hanging. She watches as a YOUNG BOY loses his grip and flops to the ground. TRINA unhooks and flops to the ground. We follow her as s runs on the ceiling of the cabin towards the BOY. She get there and starts lifting him towards his FATHER.
The ATC voice now plays loudly through the entire cockpit
SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. I see your position 4 and a half miles southeast of the airport. Descending out of 1,800. Are you
It takes Whip a second to find the mic key on his inverte yoke...
Uh, Atlanta...we're inverted. There's a very pregnant pause...
Uh, SouthJet 227...say again sir. Did you say inverted? EVANS seems calmed by WHIP'S workaday attitude about thei insane tragedy. But suddenly...
WE HEAR A HORRIBLE, METALLIC GRINDING SOUND as the engine become oil-deprived.
We're flying!
Evans pulls the Fire Bottle handle. Whip BARKS at air traffic control.
(into his mic)
227, three miles, and one o'clock.
(into his mic) We're not gonna make that!
A small white church on a hill -- 100 yards past the chur is a soy bean field and a two-lane blacktop.
(into his mic) There's a field and a road ah...we're gonna put it down in that field.
Roger, SouthJet 227. BACK TO ACTION -- CLOSE ON WHIP -- HE CALMLY FIGHTS ON. EVANS is breathing heavy as his face is beet red from the blood rushing to it.

head_text.subj: I START THE ROLL, THROW EVERYTHING
THE NERVE-WRACKING ALARMS CONTINUE TO SOUND

text: Evans deploys the right engine Fire Bottle.
(into his mic)
Eight hundred, descending...
We have enough speed to fly!

head_text.subj: WE'RE LOSING POWER IN THE RIGHT
WHIP PULLS HARD ON HIS YOKE

text: STARTS TO RIGHT ITSELF. Whip yanks back the throttles!
Evans and Whip deploy every bit of drag they can think of

SouthJet 227, altitude 500 indicated, descending. Do you concur? We follow WHIP's eye line that takes us off the control p and to the windshield. THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD WE SEE -- the landscape and the ch steeple getting closer and closer. 38. The plane does a clumsy roll to the right -- AND GETS STU
EVANS pushes the power to full thrust AND THE PLANE FINIS

TRINA is still struggling to strap herself in to her jumpseat. The plane rolls! She sees Camelia... P.O.V. -- Camelia is tossed across a row of SCREAMING passengers. TRINA loses her grip and is violently thrown against the galley wall! Like a rag doll, CAMELIA is hurled down the cabin aisle a the plane plummets! Trina slides across the galley floor and CRACKS her head the jumpseat.
Whip frantically spins the trim wheel!

head_text.subj: THE CHURCH SPIRE IS COMING RIGHT AT US
WING CLIPS THE STEEPLE, SHEARING OFF THE CROSS

text: WE HEAR A HORRIFIC, METALLIC GRINDING -- followed by a TERRIFYING SILENCE -- RIGHT ENGINE STOPS.
An unnerving quiet descends over the passenger cabin. The only SOUND is the wind RUSHING past the air-frame.
(to himself, incredulous) Are we gliding? 39.

head_text.subj: WE'RE DROPPING RAPIDLY TOWARD THE GROUND

text: GATHERED NEAR A POND IN THE CHURCHYARD SCATTER -- some ar wearing long white robes.
Oh God.

head_text.subj: ALL SOUND FADES AWAY AS THE SCREEN BLEEDS HOT WHITE --

text: And in a final, ironic, cosmic gesture --

head_text.subj: WHIP'S CONTROL YOKE HURDLES TOWARD HIM

text: WE SEE Whip's lower torso being pulled from the wreckage There is swirling SMOKE AND DUST, SMALL FIRES -- 40. Evans strapped in his chair, bleeding -- Margaret SOBS uncontrollably -- FADE OUT.

WHIP's being pulled up a grassy hillside. In the distance WHIP can see the shattered airplane lying in a crater. Fi smoulder around the impact zone. Passengers are joined by first responders as they frantically carry, drag and walk injured and the dead from the plane. WHIP sees a fire tru fly by him, down the grassy slope towards the burning pla FADE OUT.
LOOKING UP at the sky -- WE SEE black, oily SMOKE billowi across the shattered church steeple -- WE GLIMPSE PEOPLE rushing past, some are wearing white flowing robes --

head_text.subj: WE HEAR DISTANT SIRENS APPROACHING AND PEOPLE PRAYING --

text: LOOKING UP at the ceiling of an ambulance -- TWO EMTS are urgently attending to him -- FADE OUT.
A halogen overhead light and an air-conditioning vent -- brown-stained acoustic ceiling tiles -- WE HEAR the rhythmic BEEP of a heart monitor --
WHIP's eyes open to see the halogen overhead lights of a hospital room. He turns his head slightly to see the flic of a TV with no sound.

A news show runs a loop of eye witness cell phone footage the plane turning over and crashing belly down. A MAN who has been watching the TV turns to see that WHIP awake. The MAN turns off the TV, gets up and approaches WHIP's bedside. WHIP knows him.
Charlie Anderson. CHARLIE ANDERSON is a late 50's former military pilot who carries that familiar air of Texas comfort and entitlemen
How you feelin' Whip? Initial reports look like you pulled some move up there, kid. You saved a lot of lives. WHIP is moved by the first realization of survival.
How many? CHARLIE moves close to deliver the news.
102 souls on board including the flight crew, and 96 of them survived the crash. Six people died. 2 crew, 4 passengers.
4 passengers. Are the rest badly hurt? Who'd we lose on the crew? A NURSE enters the room. CHARLIE nods to her. 42.

Listen, protocol is the NTSB has to make the first contact with you and the agent is here. Let me go get him. CHARLIE ducks out of the room. WHIP is alone and still getting his bearings. He goes to scratch his head and catches sight of his left hand. It's swollen and sore --h wrist is bandaged with a splint-brace. He now looks at bo of his hands in wonder. WHIP hears a muffled conversation that gets clearer as do images of MANY PEOPLE entering the room. A POLICE OFFICER accompanies a DOCTOR and TWO NTSB AGENTS. An NTSB AGENT holds a small voice recorder towards WHIP.
Captain William Whitaker? Nod if you can hear me and understand me.

I'm Craig Matson from the NTSB and I'm required as the lead on the Go Team to make an initial contact with you after a major incident like the one you had today. WHIP nods as his senses are getting sharper.
You are in a hospital in South Atlanta. Are you aware that you were piloting a plane that went down?
I have a doctor here who can explain your medical situation. WHIP offers a "thumbs up" gesture. The DOCTOR steps in.

I'm Doctor Kenan and the good news is that you are in good condition. You did suffer a concussion which is the reason you have a bit of blurred vision and a headache. You have numerous lacerations around your left eye. We're going to leave the patch on for a few days as a precaution. But it seems your eye is OK. MRI's show strained tendons in your left knee and ankle but you didn't break any bones. 43. You have some deep bruising in your left thigh and you have a few torn ligaments in your left wrist. Nothing serious. So as soon as we clear you from the concussion, and you feel well enough -- you can go home. That could be a day, could be 3 days. Okay? WHIP quietly nods. The DOCTOR leaves and WHIP begins to study his body. His left leg is wrapped, his left wrist h a splint-brace --
I won't ask too much of you tonight, but as I said, the NTSB is required to make initial contact. How much do you remember about the flight? WHIP looks at the NTSB OFFICER and slowly speaks.
I remember everything until the crash. WHIP's voice is failing him as his throat is sore and dry

Okay Mr. Whitaker, that's fine. I am required to inform you that this incident did result in the loss of life. (checks an index card) The most current information states that of the 102 souls on board we lost 6. 2 crew members and 4 passengers. 59 people were treated and released. 37 people remain in the hospital and 3 of those cases are listed as critical.
Who on the crew died?
Two flight attendants; (checks a note card) Camelia Satou and Katerina Marquez WHIP tries to exhale as the loss of TRINA sinks in. 44.

The rep from your Pilot's Union, Mr. Anderson, will act as our contact for you. It's important to follow your Union's guidance on press and media. The pilot's union works closely with the NTSB. So, I'm gonna head out. Good luck Mr. Whitaker. WHIP nods as the NTSB OFFICER leaves with the police and other officials in tow. CHARLIE returns to WHIP's side.
I knew Trina Marquez. We spent some time together.
Apparently she wasn't strapped in. A survivor reported that she was assisting a kid. CHARLIE tries to put a reassuring hand on WHIP's shoulder
How's Margaret Thomason?

(checks his notes) Broken collar bone, cuts, banged up, but she's okay. She's here too. Ken Evans your copilot took a bad shot to the head. They're keepin' him in a coma to let the brain swelling go down. He's listed as critical, but we feel good about him. He's gonna be okay. WHIP lets that information land as his head is swirling.
Charlie, why are you here?
I'm flying a desk now. I'm a regional rep for the IAP.
You're the rep for the pilots' union? 45.
I'm one of a few union reps for the southeast. When your plane went down all the reps got a page and since I know you I shot my hand up and said I wanted to come and be the first face you'd see.
I'm glad it's you. WHIP starts to weep as he needs to begin the long process expressing this trauma.
It's good to see you too, Cowboy. You're gonna be okay. We're gonna take care of you. That's my job. WHIP nods as he wipes his eyes on his heavily bandaged ha
The union will put out a statement on your behalf. Condolences to the families who lost loved ones and gratitude to the brave men and women on the flight crew.
And I know you and Deana have been divorced for a while but maybe she and your son...?
Yeah, Knuckles.
Yeah, how old's he now?

Wow, you weren't even married when we flew for Delta. We're dinosaurs, Whip. Do you want me to reach out to Deana and see if she and Will want to come? Any family you want here, we'll get them here, stat. WHIP thinks about his long since fractured family...
No, I'll call her. 46.

Speaking of which, I have your phone and some of your personal effects from the plane. CHARLIE has a zip-locked bag with his phone, keys, sungla and wallet. WHIP looks at them, odd to see them encased i plastic.
Your clothes are toast. Do you need me to get you some stuff?
No, I'm okay. I'll take care of it.
I'm gonna head out, let you get some rest. I'm coming back. You'll see plenty of me. CHARLIE hands WHIP his card.
Thanks Charlie, I really... (Whip begins to crack) It means a lot to me that you came.
Okay. Get some rest now.
Charlie, that plane was fucked.

I know. The way you landed that plane was nothing short of a miracle. WHIP nods trying to pull it together. CHARLIE pats WHIP's shoulder before he leaves. WHIP sits up and pulls his pho from the plastic bag. Dials, waits...

Harling...Harling...yeah, it's Whip. I'm in a hospital in South Atlanta...what? You know where I am? Okay well fuck...yeah, I'm okay. What? Well, I'm looking to get outta here...hopefully tomorrow. Yeah. But, listen, I need you to bring me something to wear. 47. I don't know -- clothes -- and smokes, I really need smokes. Tee shirt, sweat pants....Harling? I'll put you on the visiting list. Yeah...and smokes. Just be low key, no fucking around, Harling. Cigarettes. Okay? I need cigarettes. Yeah. Good. WHIP closes his eyes and exhales. He now stares at the fo of the bed for a long, long moment. WHIP squeezes his eye shut tight -- holding back tears. Then quietly, as if whispering a prayer...
Goddamn it...

The Stones "Sympathy for the Devil" kicks up as we wait.. The doors split open and HARLING MAYS steps out. HARLING a pony tail and a goatee and is probably wearing a Tommy Bahama button down shirt. We follow HARLING as he strides down the hall. With ear b in, HARLING points a Sanyo pistol-shaped cam corder at th ATTENDING NURSE at the nurses' station, recording her...
I'm on the list baby girl. Check the list for Mr. Mays. Harling. The Stones continue to wail as Harling strolls on, adjust the duffel bag he has slung over his shoulder.
HARLING stands in the doorway looking in. He sees... The MORNING NURSE is helping WHIP to stand. HARLING point his camcorder at WHIP and the NURSE.
If this is gonna turn into a sponge bath, I'll come back.
HARLING immediately goes to WHIP and supports him. 48.
It's okay, Harling.
That's right honey, I'm on the list. Harling Mays. Some say they Harling knew me. HARLING boxes her out. She steps away.

Honey can you hustle us a couple of daiquiris and a cocktail weenie? On second thought just bring the booze. I brought my own weenie. No reaction as the NURSE collects the trash and towels. HARLING focuses his camcorder on the NURSE and leaves WHI an unsteady stance. HARLING films her and comments...
She's offended, and she should be. I'm a pig. And I hate me. That's what we have in common Nurse Ratched...we both hate me. And she's gone. HARLING turns to WHIP.

Whip? What the fuck my man? They're sayin', "Sweet Jesus, what a fuckin' stud that pilot is." You're a hero, no shit. You will never pay for another drink in this life time. There is crazy news people all over, look at this shit-- HARLING helps WHIP to the window...
From WHIP's window we can see a slew of news vans with si towers as well as reporters milling about -- a small zoo.
HARLING and WHIP stare for a moment at the circus below. WHIP doesn't last long and slowly returns to the bed as HARLING continues to gawk. 49.

Classic hero worship, you're a rock star man. You gotta see the video I've got -- I'm making a doc about you, well us, y'know? HARLING pulls an iPad out of his knapsack and flips it op He lets a collection of videos run...
This is outside your condo... On HARLING's iPad we see footage of PRESS swarming outsid WHIP's condo. We also see the crash scene footage.

Look that's me, and that`s Mark Mellon...you know that douchey talking haircut from local Atlanta channel 3? I said a few words. Just straight talk, y'know? WHIP's hands shake as he grabs the bed frame. HARLING tak notice and stashes the iPad...
You okay Captain Whitaker? Easy... HARLING helps him get settled. We see the beads of sweat WHIP's lip and forehead.

The meds they're giving me are fucking me up -- I'm all shaky and dried out. I can't sleep good. HARLING immediately picks up the small paper cup that hol WHIP's pain meds. He fishes out the two pills and stares them. HARLING shakes his head.

Aprazolam? That's generic Xanax and this Hydrocodone is generic Vicodin. It's shit, prolly Canadian. HARLING casually tosses the pills down his gullet and expertly swallows them without water. He grabs WHIP's medical chart and scours it as he prattles on...

We want the premium stuff. Blue label...not the fucking well shit. Where's the dihydromorphinone? 50. Or just some fucking Palladone would suffice. What is this? Fucking amateur hour over here? Get that goddamned doctor in here. You just saved a 100 people from death, they should get your fuckin' meds right. (calls to the door)
Listen Harling, leave it alone.
So you got my message and decided not to call me back? Did you bring me smokes?

I decided to come by instead. And yes I got your fucking message and yes I brought you smokes. HARLING hands WHIP a pack of smokes from his pocket. He a pulls out a carton of smokes from his backpack.

Here is a fresh carton, enjoy. You fucking earned it -- you smoke your nuts off, champion. If I were you I'd fire up right here in the God damn room. Fuck'em, you're immortal, you're a fucking God man.
Harling... WHIP motions with his hands to "calm down."
Sorry Whip. It's just...this is big time, man. You're a hero in a time when we really need heroes.
Shut the fuck up, Harling...Six people died.

96 people lived! When are you gonna take yes for an answer? Pick up the phone, man. Fuck. HARLING pulls something from his vest pocket and puts it WHIP'S hand. WHIP looks at it and back at HARLING. 51.
Here's a pint of Smirnoff and a few Red Bulls. You know what I'm sayin'? I know my customer. HARLING continues to pull items from the bag.
Harling, take the vodka with you. HARLING freezes his frenzied energy with this odd command
What?! Take the vodka? Dude, are you insane? I'm gonna just tuck it in the bottom of your-
Take the fucking vodka! HARLING hears him this time and raises his hand and nods, putting the VODKA back in his own duffel. HARLING tosses tee shirt, sweat pants and flip-flops on the bed, then...
Okay man. Check it out. HARLING holds up a silk Japanese Happi Coat, with elabora stitching depicting colorful birds flying around Mt. Fuji
Look, I'm tired man.
I'm out. You rest up.
You gotta come and get me, tomorrow. WHIP pulls his keys from the bag that CHARLIE gave him.
Here are my keys. Go to the condo and bring me some nice clothes I can wear, my phone charger and grab the veal outta my fridge. It's marked.
The veal? 52.
Yeah, the veal that's in my freezer.
Done and done. What time you need me here?
Tomorrow. I'll call you.
Send the mayday and you're outta here in 7 minutes.

I got you a few stroke mags too. I've been in hospitals. I know what you need. JUGS, HOT MILFS in heat. ASSMASTERS. You should just stroke it all day. You're a hero -- know what I'm saying? If I was in here I'd be jerkin' it all day long. See, there's a smile. HARLING puts his hand on WHIP's forehead in an attempt to reassure him. A quiet moment before HARLING slips out.

WHIP wakes up in a cold sweat. He is breathing heavy as h scans the room. LIGHTENING FLASHES from outside the windo Thunder RUMBLES. WHIP looks to the night stand where we see a pack of nico gum has been chewed through. WHIP uses his hands to get t the edge of the bed. He roots through the duffle bag that HARLING left and finds a pack of smokes and a Bic lighter still in its package. Determined to smoke, WHIP eyes a WHEEL CHAIR that has bee placed next to his bed. Leaning against the wheelchair is medical cane.
Wearing his Happi Coat (or robe), WHIP limps in to the em hallway with the use of his cane. He checks the quiet corridor as he begins his quest... 53.

The door swings open, and no one appears to be on the oth side. Now WHIP fights to push the heavy door open again t slip through. A hand grabs the door and holds it. WHIP walks into the sanctity of the stairwell.
We find the owner of the helping hand was NICOLE who retu to a quiet spot along the wall of the stairwell as she demurely smokes a cigarette.
Thank you. WHIP leans his cane against the wall and carefully pulls pack of smokes from his pocket.

I didn't think anyone would have the same devious thought about using the fire stairs to have a smoke... NICOLE smiles and looks down, awkward around men when she not loaded. She drops her cigarette which we see was bare smoked as she maneuvers to leave.
Don't go. I'll be quiet. He offers her a cigarette, she takes it.
We don't have to talk. Be nice to just smoke with someone. And they do. They sit in silence as the stairwell fills u with smoke. After a long beat...
Were you on the plane? WHIP studies her, she's beautiful in an exhausted way...
Yeah, I was. Were you? Nicole shakes her head.
Where were you sitting? 54.
Up near the front. Again it falls silent as we let them smoke and think in t sanctity of the fire stairs. A VOICE breaks their silence.

Tobacco's but an Indian weed, Grows green in the morn, cut down at eve; It shows our decay, We are but clay;...I love the smell of Nicotina in the morning. Smells like...victory. We hear a metallic rattle and WHIP and NICOLE look to the stairs.

Don't flee dear comrades! Really, wait for me, please. A GAUNT YOUNG MAN makes his way to their landing. He is dressed in a hospital gown and carrying an I.V. pole on w hangs a small bag of clear liquid. The man's hair has completely left him. His skin is gray. Eyes hollowed from his battle with cancer.
Can I bum a smoke? WHIP offers him a cigarette. He takes it and fires it up with a lighter he keeps stowed in the pocket of his gown.
I should quit, my cancer might get cancer.
Joke. You guys in the plane crash?
He was. WHIP looks at the ground as the GAUNT YOUNG MAN studies h
(it hits him) You're the fucking pilot. Nicole gives Whip a look. 55.
I saw you on TV. Holy shit, man. Tough deal, but you walked away or it looks like you limped away.
Yeah, I'm lucky. Goin' home tomorrow.
Home. Home for me is the basement, they keep cancer treatment in the basement. I'm livin' here.
You're living here?
No. I'm dying here.
What kind of cancer?
Fibro-mixzoid sarcoma, soft tissue sarcoma. Very rare, God chose me. GAUNT YOUNG MAN laughs.
God chose you? You believe in God?
Fuck yeah bitch. You're a stupid fucker if you don't believe in God. The GOD topic has silenced the stairwell...

As soon as you realize that the random events in your life are God...you will live a much better life. You spend your life believing that you have all the control over what happens. Bullshit. The plane you're flying goes down? Out of your control. God gives you cancer. I have no control over that. Did God give me cancer? You bet your ass God gave me cancer. You think if I begged for cancer God would have given it to me? 56. No...because I assure you I have begged for God to take it away - and guess what? I have no control over that. GAUNT YOUNG MAN smokes the cig to the nub and rubs the remains against the smooth concrete wall.

Can I get another smoke? What's wrong with you honey? You're beautiful, do you know that? Do I scare you? People either have to pretend they don't see me or they're drawn to me. It's funny because people see me as being close to the other side -- they feel like I have power or wisdom. They think I have the answers. Who knows? Maybe I do. Death gives you perspective. I lived my life so indecisive, in a haze. But now that I'm dying everything is so clear. It all makes sense somehow. I'm sorry but I can't get over how beautiful you are? Look at your arm, you an addict? NICOLE looks at him. She nods.
What's your name?
Nicole.
What do you do in the world Nicole? She laughs, what a question.
Not much. I was a photographer and then I was a masseuse and I wash hair at a salon sometimes.
Where is it? I'll come by, I'm easy, you can wash my head.
Do you think you're gonna die? NICOLE laughs to keep from weeping. 57.
You're not. You're not gonna die. The men watch as NICOLE quietly cries, it's powerful.
Don't you love her?
I don't know her.

Bullshit, I do. Random act of God? Don't think so. Survive a plane crash to meet a gorgeous girl in a stairwell. Fuck you man. (he reflects, then...) I'm sure they're looking for me. My family just showed up from Utah. You know it's bad when they start flying in. Every morning is special now, I'm so grateful. It's a trip, wish I could bottle this feeling I have...about how beautiful every breath of life is.. GAUNT YOUNG MAN starts laughing. WHIP joins him.
Can I get a smoke for the road?
Here's a pack.

Thank you, I'll pass them out in the cancer ward. Take care Nicole, you're gonna be okay. The GAUNT YOUNG MAN leaves, clanging away with his I.V. p NICOLE wipes away her tears, we see her hospital bracelet well as her track marks.
Chemo brain. Chemo makes you pretty foggy.
Yeah? 58.
They call it chemo brain, my mom used to slur her words and get all chatty.
Your mom had cancer.
Breast cancer, she was only 54. It's quiet.
But why'd that guy ask you if you were gonna die?
I dunno. I flat-lined twice in the ambulance. Heroin addicts who use needles tend to die. Especially women for some reason.
Is that right?
I have a pamphlet to prove it. A girl from AA just came to see me --

That guy was a trip. He made it feel like, I dunno...we were the last people left on the planet.. (drops her smoke) ...and together we should save the world. NICOLE steps on her cigarette and puts the nub in her poc She begins to leave. WHIP stops her.
Well, where should we live? If we're gonna save the world, where should we do that? NICOLE laughs.
What?
You don't want me. WHIP laughs. 59.
What?
You don't want me either. NICOLE's laugh tapers off as she senses his honesty.
Where do you live?
Why you wanna come visit? It's luxurious. (silence between them) I live in Bankhead, it's south Atlanta, near the bus station.
The luxurious bus station?
Yeah.
I'll come visit you.
You're sweet.
I will. What's your address? She measures him.
I live at the Georgian Gardens on Taylor street.
Georgian Gardens?
Yeah.
How long are you staying here?
Trying to stay as long as I can but I don't have insurance to cover rehab. I'll prolly be out tomorrow. 60.
Oh. Okay. And you're a masseuse?
Yeah.
What kind of masseuse?
I've been every kind of masseuse there is. There is strong tension between them. An orderly busts through the down the stairs. This breaks their stare.
Good luck Nicole.
You too. WHIP leaves NICOLE where he found her.

location: ST. FRANCIS REGIONAL MEDICAL HOSPITAL-LOADING DOCK-D

text: WHIP is wheeled out of a service exit by an ORDERLY who a holds the duffle bag of WHIP's stuff around his neck. Whi longer wears the eye patch but has a butterfly bandage ov his left eye brow. HARLING jumps out of his 2001 Cadillac STS and immediatel takes over, grabbing the duffel bag.
Thanks Mike. The ORDERLY tries to hand WHIP a medical file. HARLING snatches it.
Yeah, thanks Mike. (Harling tips him) Here's 20 American.
Thanks. Good luck, sir. HARLING hugs WHIP who hangs on tight. The ORDERLY spins t chair around and heads back inside. HARLING uses his key fob to remotely pop the trunk and st Whip's duffel. 61.

This is how they get the Stones out of Madison Square Garden, man. 4 smoked black limos fly outta the VIP driveway and the fans jump on the limos...mayhem. Those limos? Empty. Meanwhile, Mick and the boys go out the service exit into delivery vans -- casual, rock star type shit. HARLING helps him into the front seat and they pull away. The Stones, "Gimme Shelter" starts to play... 53 As they drive off, we see media mayhem collected in fr the hospital. Trucks with towers, cameramen, stringers an newscasters add to catering trucks and coffee stands as t vultures wait for the carrion of sound bytes and footage survivors.

Whip watches through the rear window -- the "Media Circus disappears as the Caddy rounds a corner. The back seat is piled with Whip's clothes, most of them still on hangers. HARLING lights a cigarette and hands one to WHIP who take it.

I couldn't find any suitcases so I just put your shit in grocery bags. HARLING pulls a cold Becks from a cooler on the floor of back seat and uses a bottle opener that's been screwed to dash of his car next to the radio to open the beer. He offers the beer to WHIP who waves it off. HARLING gladly keeps it for himself... "Gimme Shelter" continues to play
So you're stayin' with me down on University, right? It's nice. A lotta young people...good vibe. Harling tosses Whip a freezer bag marked:"VEAL" -- Whip begins to open it.
No. I'm gonna go to the farm.
The fucking farm? 62.
My dad's place. I can't stay at my condo.
I thought you sold that fucking place.
Not yet.
I'm not sure I wanna stay at the farm.
You're not. Just take me to the airport to get my car. Whip finishes opening the freezer bag -- it's full of cas HARLING starts to laugh...
58 Veal? Really? Don't you know the 58 first place every two-bit thief looks is in the freezer?
WHIP's BUICK turns off the blacktop past a small weathere billboard: WHITAKER CROP DUSTING. Also a real estate "FOR SALE" sign is posted in front.

Whip pulls into a long, dirt driveway that approaches a o story farm house. He gets out of the car. With his cane i one hand, he uses his free hand to toss the grocery bags close to the steps and heads inside.

WHIP ambles in and we see the interior of the house bears fading patina of a proud American Family. We see PHOTOS - WHIP in his NAVAL FLYER UNIFORM. A GROUP MILITARY PHOTO - SQUADRON of NAVAL FLIERS on a carrier. WHIP's PARENTS nex to the farm house. WHIP's FATHER stands next to WHIP who holding his infant son. 63.

WHIP empties his pockets onto the desk top. His keys, wal and his cell phone are placed next to an old rotary phone attached to an old answering machine. WHIP plugs in his c phone charge, dials in for his messages and puts it in "speaker mode" as we hear...
You have 127 messages.

Message one..."Captain Whitaker, this is Jim Court I'm with CNN. We'd like to schedule an interview..." (he deletes that message) Message two..."This is NBC affiliate KGAT in Athens we're looking to contact William J. Whitaker for..." (he deletes and moves on) Message three..."Captain Whitaker, this is Karen James, media relations with the pilots' union..." WHIP again deletes the message and decides to just shut t phone down. He continues to empty his pockets. In his jac pocket he finds a prescription bottle of pain pills. WHIP holds it up, opens it and pours a few out in his han
WHIP pours the pain pills into the toilet. He then opens medicine cabinet and starts to empty all of the bottles i the toilet.

WHIP goes to the collection of liquor bottles next to the sink that act as a makeshift bar. He picks up a bottle of vodka. He unscrews the cap and sniffs the contents. He slowly tips the bottle and pours it into the sink. Whip opens the refrigerator and removes an assortment of beers. He pops them open and pours them in the sink. The faucet running to offset the pungent smell. 64.
Whip opens a dresser drawer and finds a couple of zip-loc bags of "bud" hidden under the socks.
Whip dumps the weed into the toilet and FLUSHES it.

A cigarette dangles from WHIP's mouth as he ferrets aroun the room, showing the focus and determination of a serial killer cleaning his kill site. He finds rolling papers, roaches, more liquor and weed -- he reaches into the Shel Bag that's hanging next to the shotgun rack and finds ano "pint."

Whip opens the freezer to put in his frozen dinner and hi "packet of veal" and finds another fifth of vodka. He pours the vodka in the sink and tosses the bottle into trash -- which is piled high with empties. Through the kitchen window, Whip sees the farm's old weathered barn. Whip furrows his brow.

WHIP slides open the heavy barn doors to reveal -- A VINT CESSNA 172 -- covered in dust and bird shit from the year stagnant storage. WHIP lights a smoke as he marvels at the little piece of aviation history resting in his barn.

Whip walks past the plane and starts to examine the large two-story, open-ceilinged barn that is junked full of far equipment and old furniture. He finds... A WALL OF PHOTOS -- WHIP WITH HIS FATHER NEXT TO A PLANE. HIS GRANDFATHER, FATHER and WHIP pose next to the barn. A CROP DUSTER acts as the background for a picture with a year old WHIP and his father next to a small plane. 65. A series of pictures feature the PLANE in flight and SHOT TAKEN FROM THE PLANE, aerials of the farm, etc. WHIP holds the framed shot of he and his dad as he walks to the plane, resting his arm on the wing. WHIP pulls himself from the wall of photos and stares at stuff. We recognize what must be the stuff he took from h house after his divorce. We see bikes, weights and fishin gear. Whip rummages through a box of things packed from his hom office. Trophies, sports memorabilia, citations -- A PHOT HE AND HIS WIFE from happier times. THEIR WEDDING PHOTO. Now Whip comes upon A FRAMED BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO of he Charlie in their younger, Navy days -- wearing flight sui and standing on a carrier flight deck in front of an F-14 Tomcat. Big smiles, full of hotshot pilot swagger. WHIP puts the photo back and spots his golf bag. He roots out a pint of cheap vodka from the inner pocket. Next he finds a fifth of bourbon in his bicycle saddle ba He goes to the workbench and removes a couple of bottles the paint shelf.
63 Whip dumps out the liquor onto the grass as he hobbles to the house.
65 WHIP uses just his cane now as he drags a garbage bag 65

empty liquor bottles to his garbage cans. He tosses the b of empties in a can. His work done, WHIP lights a smoke a stares at the empty fields that run forever as does the landscape of his mind. He quietly tries to grasp the horr he endured and the reality of his survival.
We hear the microwave beep and WHIP retrieves a frozen dinner. 66.

head_text.subj: INT. WHITAKER FARM--LIVING ROOM DESK AREA--MOMENTS LATER

text: WHIP sits at the coffee table eating his frozen dinner wh watching news coverage of the crash. PHONE RINGS

WHIP is startled by the phone that never rings. He snaps the TV using the remote. WHIP is in no hurry to answer the phone as the old time r continues. WHIP goes to the desk where the phone rests an he watches the old answering machine click on. We hear...
You've reached the Whitaker Crop Dusting Company, flying lessons and plane rides. Please leave a message and it will be returned. Thank you. VOICE MAIL
...I think that was the beep. Hey Cowboy, it's Charlie again. WHIP reaches for the phone but decides to just listen to CHARLIE... CHARLIE

(speaking to voicemail) I'm back in town and I stopped by the hospital tonight but they said you went home...so I guess you're feelin' pretty good, but um we went out to your condo and the manager said you had not returned.

CHARLIE sits at a beautiful wooden table in a modern glas walled office above a baseball field. The table is popula with casually-dressed businessmen and lawyers as this aft hours meeting was called on the fly. CRASH SCENE PHOTOS and FILES fill the table top. We also a photo or two of the WHITAKER FARM. VOICE MAIL

So...you may be with relatives, which I understand. I was really hoping to see you for breakfast. I'm at the St. Regis downtown. 67. There's an executive buffet on the 16th floor - 10 o'clock, okay? If you get this, please come. Some important stuff to cover. Be good.
WHIP stands still as a beep sounds, ending the message.

The executive buffet is a staple at the ST. REGIS. A long center table with silver trays houses eggs and breakfast meats. Fruit, bagels and a staff of servers cater to the business elite of Atlanta. CHARLIE ANDERSON sits at a corner table with HUGH LANG, a young, well-dressed African American man. CHARLIE and HUG are chatting in jocular spirit when WHIP approaches, walk much more confidently with his cane. CHARLIE
Whip, hey buddy. Glad you got my message. Grab a seat. WHIP studies HUGH as he pulls out his chair. CHARLIE (CONT'D)
Whip this is Hugh Lang; he's an attorney from Chicago. HUGH stands and shakes hands with WHIP. HUGH
Nice to meet you Captain Whitaker. WHIP and HUGH remain standing, both feeling a little "alp CHARLIE
Siddown. Coffee? (Whip nods, sits) Miss, can we get some fresh coffee? She smiles and nods. She's off to get the coffee. CHARLIE (CONT'D)
We were just talking about your copilot's wife. She told a newspaper that "God landed that plane." 68. WHIP
God landed the plane? WHIP just stares at the two men who have large buffet pla surrounding them. CHARLIE
I too believe that God landed that plane. The same way I believe that God should hit the buffet, the turkey sausage is excellent. WHIP
I'm good with coffee. CHARLIE

Len Caldwell was really trying to get here this morning. (Whip seems lost) Len is the president of the pilots' union and he wanted to be here with us and meet with you but they wanted him at the crash site. So.. WHIP is quiet, anxious to hear the purpose of the meeting CHARLIE (CONT'D)
Whip, as you know, when a plane crashes, the NTSB sends a "go team" to the crash site immediately. WHIP
They find the flight data recorders? CHARLIE
Yes they found them, perfectly intact. WHIP
Great. That solves everything. The recorders will tell the story. Why do we need a lawyer from Chicago? CHARLIE
Hugh's an attorney who specializes in criminal negligence- WHIP
Criminal negligence? The WAITRESS returns with the coffee. It's quiet as they wait for her to finish. She does. 69. HUGH
Death demands responsibility. Six dead on that plane, someone has to pay. WHIP
The plane fell apart at 30 thousand feet. CHARLIE
The airline will try to prove equipment failure. Which would make the manufacturer responsible. The manufacturer of the plane will try to prove poor maintenance of the equipment by the airline. HUGH
Or pilot error. WHIP
I had to fly that plane inverted, that means upside down, Hugh. Do you get the picture? 100 passengers hanging upside down, 500 feet off the ground. Do you have any idea what that sounds like? HUGH
I do. I heard the black box last night. WHIP
Are you a pilot? HUGH LANG
No I'm not. WHIP
Then you don't know what the fuck you're talking about. CHARLIE
Hugh's on our team and it's the NTSB's ball game. They run the investigation and they will ultimately rule on the cause. HUGH
They interview the entire flight crew and the passengers. They hold PUBLIC HEARINGS-
WHIP
Charlie, what do I need to know? I'm already tired of this guy. HUGH
The NTSB `go team' collects blood, skin and hair from the flight crew for a toxicology report. WHIP studies the two men, trying to read their poker hand WHIP
When did they do that? HUGH
In the hospital. It's the first thing they do. Do you remember having your blood drawn on the night of the crash? WHIP looks at CHARLIE and then to HUGH... WHIP
Do they have the results of these blood tests? HUGH
Yeah, they do. The WAITRESS checks in. WAITRESS
Anything else for you gentlemen? WHIP
Did I just see warm cinnamon rolls come out? WAITRESS
Yes sir. WHIP
Bring me one wouldya? Actually bring me two, okay sweetie? WAITRESS
Comin' up. An awkward silence as they wait for her to clear out. HUGH

An initial report shows alcohol in your bloodstream at a level of .24. In the U.S. 71. -- one of the most lenient drunk driving countries in the world -- you go to jail for driving with a number over .08. And by driving, I mean a car. They all digest the information as the WAITRESS delivers cinnamon rolls. She leaves. It's still quiet. WHIP
What does that mean? I had a beer the night before I flew. And what...That made the tail of the plane explode? CHARLIE
Separate issues Whip- WHIP
I need a lawyer. CHARLIE
Hugh is your lawyer. WHIP
I need a bigger lawyer. A lawyer who understands that I flew a broken plane and without me at that stick there'd be 102 funerals, not 6. HUGH
We're talking about prison not funerals. Somebody has- WHIP
To write checks, well it's not me I promise you that. And as long as they're writing checks, write me one because someone put me in a broken plane. I'd love a check. CHARLIE EASY WHIP- HUGH

This tox report states that you were drunk and high on cocaine, felonies punishable by 24 years in jail. And if your intoxication is proven to have caused the death of the 4 passengers you'll get 4 counts of manslaughter. That could be life in prison. 72. Can I now do my job on your behalf and kill this tox report? WHIP is listening. CHARLIE tries to reign it in. CHARLIE
He'll get it done, Whip. It's what his entire life is about. Trust me, trust him. (Whip stares at Hugh) Don't worry Whip, you're gonna walk away the hero you deserve to be. WHIP
I'm not worried, Charlie. I promise you that. No one could have landed that plane like I did, no one. 68 The WAITRESS returns with a coffee pot. WHIP leaves. 6
Close on TV -- A SPLIT SCREEN -- CNN's PIERS MORGAN on on side of the screen asking questions of JIM TILMON, an aviation expert.

head_text.subj: WE NOW SEE A PHOTO OF WHIP IN HIS SOUTHJET AIRLINE UNIFOR

text: PIERS MORGAN
Captain Tilmon, we wanna play a portion of the black box that all of the news outlets have grabbed hold of... WHIP (ON TELEVISION)
When I ask for power, push both of these forward. Got it? What's your son's name? WIDER...WHIP STEPS UP TO THE BAR, GLANCING AROUND. The BARTENDER steps up to serve WHIP... BARTENDER
What'll you have? WHIP
Can I get an orange juice? The BARTENDER leaves to grab the orange juice. 73. TELEVISION -- The transcription and AUDIO of the cockpit recording continues...
Trevor.
Say "I love you Trevor."
Why?
The black box.
I love you Trevor. Be a good boy. Mommy loves you. The BARTENDER returns with the orange juice. BARTENDER
That's it? WHIP
And a double shot of Stoli. The BARTENDER nods and turns in acknowledgement of the or PIERS MORGAN (ON TELEVISION)
Wow. That audio paints a strong picture. Captain Whitaker is surely a hero in my opinion. JIM TILMON (ON TELEVISION)

Absolutely. However, every incident is different. The actions of the pilots on SouthJet 227 will be heavily scrutinized. It's protocol for any investigation. The BARTENDER returns with a frosted glass and pours two shots over the ice. WHIP downs the vodka in a flash. The OTHER BARTENDER has the remote and starts searching f more coverage of the crash. He stops at a local report.
A REPORTER gives a lead in at the crash site.

Kevin, it's still chaotic here at the site. Apparently a small ministry was conducting services near to where the plane came down. So the scene here is a mix of survivors and first responders, I was able to catch up with an actual passenger moments ago...

head_text.subj: A YOUNG SHORT HAIRED BLONDE MAN GIVES HIS ACCOUNT

text: PASSENGER 1

We were in a nose dive and people were screaming and yelling and then the plane turned upside down and we had to hold on to our seat belts to keep from falling out of our chairs -- I saw one kid fall to the floor and this flight attendant picked him up and handed him to his dad...I didn't see her again.

More details and more reports of the casualties are continuing to fly around. I can tell you that there appears to be many, many survivors. That's all I have for now. Kevin? Another reporter has a passenger's account.

Rebecca, surviving passengers are being put in ambulances, police cruisers and even first responder vehicles and they are being taken to local hospitals for treatment. Some of the injured appear serious and it's safe to assume at this point that there are at least a few fatalities. Let's roll the tape of the passenger I caught up with earlier. A MAN with SHORT DARK HAIR explains his experience. 75. PASSENGER 2

We turned like a corkscrew and all I could think was, "this is really happening, I'm going to die" and then all of a sudden the plane was upside down but steady and the pilot must have known how to fly it that way. He flipped it back over and landed it hard.
Obviously a harrowing ordeal for those on the troubled plane. This is Callie J Kenner for News 5. A third Reporter gets a FEMALE NEIGHBOR's perspective.
Folks in the houses that border this field came running from their houses... NEIGHBOR

I thought it was thunder at first. But it shook the ground hard. Thunder don't do like that. I ran outside and I could hear people yelling and I could see a small fire at first. I just took the dogs and headed down there. Then I saw the plane crumpled on the ground. I never seen nothing like that in my life.
Just like that plane, this community is shattered. Folks here remain on edge as media trucks continue to line their small road and crowd the field where the plane still lies. Back to you, Tom.
A news light shines on a lone reporter who stands atop a small hill above the crash field. 76.
We're gonna take another look at the cell phone footage that captured the last moments of SouthJet's Flight 227.

head_text.subj: WE SEE THE GRAINY CELL PHONE FOOTAGE OF THE PLANE

text: After the PLANE levels off and smacks down in the field, return to REPORTER #4 in the crash field.

Many hours have passed since the footage you just watched but the crash site remains active as investigators work through the night. Using flood lights and miners' caps, teams continue to comb the crash field looking for the answers to the hard questions as to what brought down SouthJet's flight 227.
